TopicTitle: {AMRSD} Star wars Y-Wing. WAY to many greebles, 639 parts.

Articles.Content:
So, after seeing Majorjim's awesome snowspeeder, I decided to make my own star wars craft. I present to you... 

The Y-Wing fighter-bomber!

![MKAWik2.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/MKAWik2.png?1)

The Y-Wing holds one pilot, one gunner in a position behind the cockpit, and one astromech droid. It is armed with 2 forward-mounted laser cannons, along with 2 proton torpedo launchers. The Y-Wing comes with streamlined hull plating, but many people, especially in the rebel alliance, who work on these craft remove the plating from the nacelles and main hull, as it makes it easier to maintain and gives a slight performance improvement. Generally the cockpit plating isn't removed, since the cockpit area needs less repair. The Y-Wing is notoriously slow, but makes up for that with it's heavy armament.

639 parts.

Two thud engines.

Requires infinite fuel.

Now, for some pictures:

![mIU8CL1.png](http://i.imgur.com/mIU8CL1.png)

![f8qEYmD.png](http://i.imgur.com/f8qEYmD.png)

![dxjQfRr.png](http://i.imgur.com/dxjQfRr.png)

![bNF4aBi.png](http://i.imgur.com/bNF4aBi.png)

Edit:

esinohio's render:

![nBHBUSG.png](http://i.imgur.com/nBHBUSG.png)

Enjoy!

[Download](http://kerbalx.com/Mad_Rocket_Scientist/AMRSD-Y-Wing)

This is super well done. It looks awesome. The engines are really cool looking and all the extra stuff for decoration makes it look super legit.

> This is super well done. It looks awesome. The engines are really cool looking and all the extra stuff for decoration makes it look super legit.

Thanks! The detail stuff was surprisingly easy, the cockpit was the hardest to get right.
I remember my parents bought me one, back in '82. This one is indeed, very well done!
